newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish shares end higher in buoyant market.
newsitem.headline: Swedish shares end higher in buoyant market.

text.p: Sweden's bourse ended higher on Wednesday as the market recouped some of its heavy losses from Tuesday.
The general index rose 0.91 percent to 1,985.09 with shares worth 2.8 billion crowns changing hands.
Brokers said cyclical stocks were the focus of the market with strong buying interest.
"There is a real draw to the cyclicals now," one broker said.
Telecoms giant Ericsson rose 3.50 crowns to 153.50 crowns while car manufacturer Volvo gained 1.50 to 142 crowns.
Appliance maker Electrolux climbed 3.50 crowns to 389 crowns.
The best performing sector of the day was the banking and insurance sector that rose 1.65 percent. S-E-Banken gained 0.50 crown to 56.50 crowns and Handelsbanken rose 3.50 crowns to 138.50 crowns.

The forestry sector also saw strong gains with the index rising 1.28 percent following a stronger performance on Wall Street overnight. MoDo rose 1.50 to 192 crowns and Stora closed 1.50 crowns higher at 93.50 crowns.
